data.conditions: 6am - With back to back days of 1" reported at JHMR, it feels like dry January was all a dream. You'll want an extra layer or two if you plan to enjoy today's bounty, especially during the morning hours with single digit temps sticking around until just before noon. Mostly clear skies will provide ample sunshine to light your way before clouds build back up in the evening hours. Breezy winds prevailing from the West are forecast to be 10-20mph with gusts of 30mph+ possible along ridgetops. Afternoon temps will be in the low 20s at the base and stick in the teens higher up. We hope to see you here! - Orion

forecast_days.skies: Snow And Rain. Snow And Rain

forecast.day_comments: Snow showers.  High near 19. Calm wind.  Chance of precipitation is 80%. Total daytime snow accumulation of 1 to 3 inches possible.
forecast.night_comments: Snow showers likely, mainly before 7pm.  Cloudy during the early evening, then gradual clearing, with a low around 0. Wind chill values as low as -12. Northwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.  Chance of precipitation is 60%. New snow accumulation of less than a half inch possible.
